purpose: To explain the importance of fraud scoring models in fraud prevention strategies and emphasize the understanding of model performance.
title: Predictive Modeling

bullets.text: Authorizations are assigned a score based on the transactionsâ€™ likelihood of being fraud
Certain scoring models are based on consortium data pulling in attributes of both the merchant and like cardholder spend
Industry model scoring can help determine the risk of individual transactions
Mastercard Decision Intelligence considers the risk and reward of transactions
The use of more than one scoring model has shown to augment and enhance existing performance by reducing fraud and limiting customer impact
Once a risk appetite is established, the model performance can be analyzed to determine appropriate score threshold settings
Based on the score, rules can be written to decline activity, approve and queue for manual review, or approve and not queue
